newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China's Sinopec sets US$100 mln term loan.
newsitem.headline: China's Sinopec sets US$100 mln term loan.

text.p: China Petrochemical Corp (Sinopec) has launched a US$100 million term loan facility, bankers said.
They said the amortisating loan carries a maturity of eight years and has an average life of six years.
It pays a margin of 37.5 basis points over the London Interbank Offered Rate for the first four years and 50 basis points over LIBOR thereafter.
Fees are 30 basis points for co-arrangers committing to US$10 million or more and 20 basis points for senior managers committing to US$5-9 million.
Proceeds of the loan will be used for general working capital.
Chase Manhattan Asia, Industrial Bank of Japan and Sanwa Bank are arrangers for the deal.
